d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:43): There's all sorts of Lore in the infrastructure Wiki about the process of using it, and the awk scripts we've for some reason written to adapt our current student management output to work with this old script =P

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:43): Rather than rewriting the script.

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:44): Date of birth formatting errors or something.
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (11:47): jamesd: What you really want is some kinda conditional nat, if the packets from 192.168.2 are *not* going to 192.168.1 only
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (11:47): not sure how to do that
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (11:48): Me either
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:51): Conditional NAT as in, perform NAT unless the destination is 192.168.1/24 ?
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:52): With ipnat I guess?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (11:53): forward packets from 192.168.2.0/24 unless the dest is  192.168.1.0/24
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:53): So 192.168.2 wants Internet, but 192.168.1 is also connected to the router?
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (11:55): LeftWing: Have you seen the diagram?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (11:56): LeftWing, see the network diagram at  uadmin.blogspot.com
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (11:56): I'll have a look-ee
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (12:00): So the default gateway for everything on .1/24 is the cheapfirewall?
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (12:01): jamesd: http://www.obfuscation.org/ipf/ipf-howto.html#TOC_33
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (12:03): Anyway, I'm off
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (12:03): Night, all
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (12:03): It would more likely be "to ! <addr>" from memory

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (12:04): Quite often, we will find ourselves in need of having NAT behave differently based on which source and destination addresses are being used. For example, we might want to always NAT unless we are speaking with a specific subnet:
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (12:04): Oh, here's a q: If I take a QFE from a sparc box and put it in an x86 box, should I expect it to work under solaris?
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (12:05): jamesd: Ah, cool.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (12:05): and i guess i should add  "portmap tcp/udp auto"  to the end

d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (12:06): jamesd: You can probably leave that portmap business off the end, as it's auto by default
d91102e790545be0a09c1f715ac4926b (12:06): jamesd: My NAT Internet line looks like:  map tun0 10.0.1.0/24 -> 0/32 mssclamp 1460
